required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Virtual Study of Patient Reported Behaviors and Health Outcomes in Individuals With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Behavioral, Functional, and Clinical Patient-Reported Outcomes (PROs) in Subjects Diagnosed With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to identify and describe patient behaviors and clinical outcomes among patients who have tested positive for mild to moderate COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: This virtual observational cohort study will describe patient behaviors and clinical outcomes of subjects who tested positive for COVID-19. Among those with positive tests, predictors of time to recovery, post-COVID function and outcomes will be identified. Individuals who test negative and positive for SARS-CoV-2 will be enrolled in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: To identify and describe patient behaviors and clinical outcomes among patients who have tested positive for COVID-19

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe recovery in patients with test-confirmed COVID-19 infection including time to recovery and functional improvement
To develop prediction tools for time to recovery, function and outcomes in patients with COVID-19 identified by home testing
To describe users and the utilization of COVID-19 home testing over time by geography, demographics, and comorbidity
To describe the feasibility of COVID-19 home testing

intervention.description: Participants who have tested positive for SARS-CoV-2, both with and without symptoms
Participants who have tested negative for SARS-CoV-2

study_pop.textblock: Individuals who have valid COVID-19 test results.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >=18 years
- Individuals with a valid diagnostic COVID-19 test result
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent
